intro: Plectronia moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan plectronia, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its vibrant floral display.
